attribute.description: Unique identifier of the component in a naming container.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Boolean value to specify the rendering of the component, when set to false component will not be rendered.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An EL expression referring to a server side UIComponent instance in a backing bean.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Name of the client side widget.
attribute.name: widgetVar

attribute.description: Defines if the editor is readonly.
attribute.name: readonly

attribute.description: Defines if the editor is disabled.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The tab index to assign to the editor. If not given, no tab index will be assigned.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: A display name for this component.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: An EL expression or a literal text that defines a converter for the component. When it's an EL expression, it's resolved to a converter instance. In case it's a static text, it must refer to a converter id.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: Message to display when required field validation fails.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: Message to display when conversion fails.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: Message to display when validation fails.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: A method expression referring to a method validationg the input.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: Language for the monaco editor, eg. typescript, javascript, css, or html.
attribute.name: codeLanguage

attribute.description: Interface for the user interface. By default, language files exists for eng (English), deu (German), fra (French), jpn (Japanese).
attribute.name: uiLanguage

attribute.description: An expression that evaluates to an extender object. Either an expression that evaluates to an extender object, or a script file with an extender object. First, attempt to evaluate the given string as a JavaScript expression. If this results in an object, use this as the extender object. Otherwise, prefix the given string with the appropriate base URL (eg. http://.../java.faces.resources/), and attempt to load that resource. If it loads successfully, evaluate the resource as a JavaScript expression and use that value as the extender object. Note that you must add the .xhtml prefix yourself, eg. extender.js.xhtml. In case the resource is located in a library, use the ln URL paramter, eg. extender.js.xhtml?ln=mylib.
attribute.name: extender
